N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.118 - Executive order no. 118: establishing the medicaid dental advisory committee

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the State of New York, pursuant to Title XIX of
the Federal Social Security Act, has adopted a State plan for the provision of
medical assistance, including medically necessary dental care, to those of its
citizens who are unable to pay for such care from their own resources; WHEREAS, the State of New York desires to improve access to
medically necessary dental care, especially for children; and
WHEREAS, the establishment of a Medicaid Dental Advisory

Committee may assist the Commissioner of Health in improving access to dental
services by Medicaid recipients. NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby establish the Medicaid Dental Advisory

Committee. The Committee shall consist of eight members appointed by the

Governor, four of whom shall be recommended by the New York State Dental

Association and four of whom shall be recommended by the New York State

Department of Health. 1. The Committee
shall: a)

Develop recommendations for (i)
patient education concerning dental health, (ii) initiatives to recruit
additional dental providers and (iii) initiatives to increase the acceptance of
new Medicaid patients by participating providers. b)

Evaluate the Medicaid dental fee schedule
increases that were adopted on June 1, 2000 and April 1, 2001, and the dental
fee schedule increases to be adopted on April 1, 2002; and make recommendations
to the Commissioner of Health for the 12 month period commencing April 1, 2003. c)

Evaluate and make
appropriate recommendations concerning any impact of dental fee increases on
the provision of dental services in Medicaid managed care plans and Child

Health Plus plans. 2. The Committee shall meet as often as necessary to accomplish its objectives and
at least bi- monthly during its first six months of existence. 3. The members of the Committee shall receive
no compensation but shall be entitled to reimbursement for any actual and
necessary expenses incurred in connection with the performance of their
duties. 4. The Committee shall
remain in existence until March 31, 2004. Signed: George E. PatakiDated: March 4, 2002
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
